page.title: 07CATFIELD VILLAGE
page.content: The name Catfield may be a shortened form of "St.Catherine's Field", or possibly a derivation of "Field of the Wild Cats". It is a small village with a population of approximately 800 people. The village is surrounded by fields containing crops. Many village activities are centred around the church and Sunday Chapel. Both have Sunday schools for the children. The chapel also runs a youth club. The village hall, which stands next to the playing field, can be booked for parties. It is also the home of the W.I. and the Old Folk's club. The Post Office and public house are situated on a double bend in the centre of the village. Towards the by pass is the industrial estate. Opposite Catfield Mushroom Farm is Bleak House where parties and fetes are held on the lawn.
